quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Michigan and Following
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, michigan, drivers. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is the capital of Michigan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Lansing

questions.question: Michigan is home to two NHL hockey teams.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In which language Frohliche Weihnachten is wished on Christmas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: German

questions.question: The Little League World Series is held in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Williamsport

questions.question: Which of the following was first created by Benjamin Franklin?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Zoo

questions.question: What animal is the dominant object on the Michigan state flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Deer

questions.question: Because of its shape Michigan was given this nickname.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mitten State

questions.question: The name of Michigan is a French adaptation of the Ojibwe word meaning what?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Large water

questions.question: General Washington slept here during the winter of 1777 - 1778.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Valley Forge

questions.question: Michigan is comprised of two entirely separate land masses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Michigan is considered to be primarily a Democratic Party state rather than a Republican Party state.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Drivers Education classes were first offered in this Pennsylvania town.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: State College

questions.question: How long is the Mackinac Bridge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 5 Miles

questions.question: Children in Michigan are taught to remember this word in order to easily recall all of Michigans great lakes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: H.O.M.E.S.

questions.question: What connects the upper and lower peninsulas of Michigan?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Mackinac Bridge

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Poem and Language
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mean, profession. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Bartletts Book of Anecdotes describes this poet and short story writer as a doyenne of light verse and wit. This line is from her most often quoted poem: Men seldom make passes At girls who wear glasses. Name the author of this poem.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dorothy Parker

questions.question: Judging by the non-Latin letters, in which language is the following Christmas greeting С Рождеством Христовым (D Rojdestvom Hristovym)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Russian

questions.question: What American hero does Henry Wadsworth Longfellow write about in this poem:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Paul Revere

questions.question: What was the profession of the man who first performed Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer, before he made it big as a singer of comedy songs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Veterinarian

questions.question: This poet, who is famous for his use of lowercase letters and word space, wrote the following:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: e e cummings

questions.question: What city does Carl Sandburg call Hog Butcher for the World and City of the Big Shoulders?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Chicago

questions.question: In Ernest Thayers poem there is no joy in Mudville because mighty Casey tore the cover off the ball to score a home run.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: How would you wish Merry Christmas to your French friend?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Joyeux Noel

questions.question: When was the song Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer first performed?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1979

questions.question: How would you wish Merry Christmas in Scottish Gaelic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nollaig Chridheil

questions.question: I saw the best minds of my generation destroyed by madness, is the opening line of Allen Ginsbergs poem Howl. Name the poetry movement with which Allan Ginsberg is associated?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Beats

questions.question: What is the name of the cousin mentioned in the song Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Mel

questions.question: In which language the Christmas greeting is Glaed Geol?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Old English

questions.question: In which language, spoken by native inhabitants of the US, does the following mean Merry Christmas and Happy New Year: Mele Kalikimaka me ka Hauʻoli Makahiki Hou?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hawaiian

questions.question: What is the name of this poem by Edna St. Vincent Millay:

options.text: t ah, my foes, and oh, my friends-

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: First Fig

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Reindeer and Following
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, field, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is Deputy Sheriff Isaac Smith?

options.text: The man that shot Ronald Regan
The first U.S. police officer to be killed in the line of duty
The first police officer to become president of the U.S.
The first chief of police in NYC

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The first U.S. police officer to be killed in the line of duty

questions.question: What does the name Texas mean?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Friend

questions.question: There was a movie based on the song Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Is it true that Interpol is a law enforcement body that is dependent on information and cooperation of police agencies throughout the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: Which of the following is not a commonly used Field Sobriety Task?

options.text: Lean Your Head Back and Touch Your Nose

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Recite The Alphabet Backwards

questions.question: What is Sir Robert Peel known as?

options.text: First police office to be killed in the line of duty
Designer of the first police car

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Father of Modern Day Policing

questions.question: How many different flags have flown over Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 6

questions.question: The term caliber in the field of firearms refers to which of the following?

options.text: Diameter of the barrel/bullet in inches
Length of the bullet in inches
Weight of the slug of a bullet

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Diameter of the barrel/bullet in inches

questions.question: Which term refers to the maneuver that police officers use to spin another car out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: P.I.T. Maneuver

questions.question: Police radar guns are commonly calibrated by which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A tuning fork

questions.question: Which of these traditional Christmas foods is not mentioned in the song Grandma Got Run Over by a Reindeer?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Fruit Cake

questions.question: City police in the U.S. gain their power and authority to arrest from which government body/person?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Governor

questions.question: Which firearm is NOT typically associated with U.S. law enforcement?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A.K. 47

questions.question: The F.O.P. is an organization for police officers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Elmo Shropshire is the narrator in a movie named Grandma Got Run Over By a Reindeer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Texas and Country
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, rodeo, infant. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Who is the famous general and Mexican president that was defeated by the Texans in the 1800s in the fight for their independence?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: General Santa Anna

questions.question: The worlds first rodeo was held in what Texas city on July 4, 1883?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pecos

questions.question: In which country does the Infant Jesus help Santa to give presents to children?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Czech Republic

questions.question: In which of these countries is Santa Claus accompanied by an assistant who carries a black sack and a book in which each childs behavior is recorded?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Holland

questions.question: The Urn of Fate is part of the traditional Christmas celebrations in what country?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Italy

questions.question: The Julbukk, a small figure made of straw, is a common Christmas decoration in Sweden. What does the Julbukk resemble?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A goat

questions.question: How many reindeer pull the sleigh of Father Frost according to beliefs in Ukraine?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three

questions.question: Which port in Texas is the largest in the USA in terms of international commerce?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Port of Houston

questions.question: Texas has more counties than any other US state. How many are there?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 254

questions.question: In Greek folk tradition the malicious creatures called the Kallikantzaroi like to play bad pranks on people at Christmas time. Which of these is believed to be a way to drive them off?

options.text: Hanging a rabbits tail on the wall
Putting a lamb next to the Christmas tree

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burning an old shoe

questions.question: What river forms the Texas/Mexico border?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rio Grande River

questions.question: How many presidential libraries are located in Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 2

questions.question: In what Texas city did the large national disaster, The Great Storm of 1900, occur?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Galveston

questions.question: Which of these was the first oil well in Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spindletop

questions.question: What was the original name of the capital of Texas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Waterloo

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Israel
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, sleigh, country. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This river, flowing through the Great Rift Valley into the Dead Sea, forms much of the border between Jordan and Israel.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Jordan river

questions.question: Which ancient city was declared Israel’s official capital with a law from January 1950?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jerusalem

questions.question: According to the tradition, on Christmas Eve, Christians in this country go to church wearing a completely new outfit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Egypt

questions.question: Which desert is situated in the southern part of Israel and covers a large part of Israels official Southern District?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Negev

questions.question: In terms of area, which US state is about the size of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Jersey

questions.question: In which country was the traditional Christmas mistletoe hung up for the first time?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: UK

questions.question: In which country was the first Christmas stamp released?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada

questions.question: What are the official languages in the linguistically and culturally diverse community of Israel?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hebrew and Arabic

questions.question: Lake Tiberias, Israels largest freshwater lake, is also known by what other name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sea of Galilee

questions.question: What are the only two colors on the Israeli flag?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blue and white

questions.question: In Australia, Santas sleigh is not pulled by reindeer but by eight white kangaroos.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Western culture cherishes the idea of a white Christmas (a Christmas with snow). Unfortunately for England, the white Christmases in the country in the entire twentieth century were not more than this number.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 7

questions.question: In which country does Santa visit children twice, once on December 4th and once on December 6th?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Belgium

questions.question: In which country are presents brought to children by a camel instead of by Santa Claus?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Syria

questions.question: In which of the following countries is Christmas not considered a day for the family?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Japan

quizzes.title: Science Quiz: Union and Shop
quizzes.description: Test your science knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Science, leader, people. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is an agency shop?

options.text: A company in which you do not have to join the union but you must pay union dues for the services the union provides
A company in which you must be a union member before you are hired
A company in which the union is owned by the employer
A company in which you have a set amount of time after which you must join the union

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A company in which you do not have to join the union but you must pay union dues for the services the union provides

questions.question: What is the definition of an open shop?

options.text: A company in which you have a set an amount of time to join a union after you are hired
A company in which you have a choice whether or not to join a union
A company  which only hires non-union employees
A company in which you have a choice of more than one union to join

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A company in which you have a choice whether or not to join a union

questions.question: The Kibbutz community, which comprises about 5% of the Israeli population, has become best known around the world as an example of what social phenomenon?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: a cooperative community

questions.question: What do you call a trade union that consists of employees of one company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A vertical trade union

questions.question: Which of the following describes a trade union consisting of people in the same type of  craft in different companies?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A horizontal union

questions.question: This union leader was President of the United Mine Workers from 1920 to 1960 and played a major role in the founding of the Congress of Industrial Organizations.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John L. Lewis

questions.question: What is a union shop?

options.text: A company in which you have a certain amount of time to join the union after you are hired
A company in which you must join the union before you are hired
A company in which you do not have to join a union but you must pay union dues for services provided by the union
A company which does not require employees to join a union

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A company in which you have a certain amount of time to join the union after you are hired

questions.question: This movie centered on A. Phillip Randolphs efforts to organize the porters at the Pullman Rail Company.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 10,00 Men Named George

questions.question: In 1936 the United Rubber Workers became the first unionists to use this tactic.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A sit-down strike

questions.question: What was the name of the first major trade union in the USA which was formed by Uriah Stephens?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Knights of Labor

questions.question: There are two main factors for Israels well-developed technology fields, the first being the lands limited natural resources. What is the second factor?

options.text: Intense exchange of scientists with other countries
High average IQ of the population

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Strong emphasis on education

questions.question: The Dead Sea, the lowest exposed point on Earths surface, has an average depth of how many feet/meters below sea level?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 1350 ft (410 m)

questions.question: What is a closed shop?

options.text: A company in which you may be employed if you are not a union member
A company in which employees have an amount of time when they must join the union
A company in which you need not join a union but you must pay union dues only for services  provided by the union
A company in which you must be a union member before you are employed

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A company in which you must be a union member before you are employed

questions.question: In 1965 this man called for a national boycott of grapes because grape pickers were being abused by their employers.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cesar Chavesz

questions.question: What is a yellow-dog contract?

options.text: An agreement between a union and an employer in which the  employer agrees to help the union form
An agreement between an employee and an employer that the employee will not join a union.
An agreement between a union and a worker in which the union agrees to help the worker find work
An agreement between an employer and a state government in which the state agrees not to enforce union rules on the companys owners

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: An agreement between an employee and an employer that the employee will not join a union.
